title: Real-time Experimental 4-D STEM Using Compressive Sensing
content: Four-dimensional scanning transmission electron microscopy (4-D STEM) is a powerful tool for the analysis of complex structures and can reveal both the structural and physical properties of materials. Unlike traditional imaging modes, a 4-D STEM experiment can be constructed to simultaneously acquire various combinations of image types, revealing both light and heavy atomic species within one dataset. These imaging modes include the use of virtual detectors (analogous to fixed, monolithic detectors), differential phase contrast to determine projected electrical properties, and ptychography [1].
